topic: Credits for Microeconomics in the Business Information Systems degree program
question: I'm studying business informatics and have a question about the credits. I completed some courses in the previous semester. I want to take Microeconomics 1 and Spanish A1 this semester. Can the credits for Microeconomics be counted as interdisciplinary basics, or are they only relevant for economics?"
answer: You can only count Microeconomics 1 as an interdisciplinary foundation if it is part of the catalog of interdisciplinary foundations and does not overlap with other modules. Please check this using your study plan in TUMonline and the website for the Business Informatics degree program.
